issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

Using boto against Eucalyptus 4.0 to get a specific bucket fails.  Looks like its trying to resolve the bucket and IP to a valid DNS name.

{code}
In [10]: boto.set_stream_logger('paws')

In [11]: s3 = boto.connect_s3(host='10.104.1.194', aws_access_key_id='AKIHTMNYTRQ0MIHQAKEY', aws_secret_access_key='yPRQ3we37Wsy26T7AA5fKhgyNlqnii2iRN2XjVTp', path='/services/objectstorage', is_secure=False, port=8773, debug=2)
2014-04-11 15:40:23,518 paws [DEBUG]:Using access key provided by client.
2014-04-11 15:40:23,518 paws [DEBUG]:Using secret key provided by client.

In [12]: bucket_name = "ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-20140411"

In [13]: bucket = s3.get_bucket(bucket_name)

/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/connection.pyc in make_request(self, method, path, headers, data, host, auth_path, sender, override_num_retries, params, retry_handler)

-> 1046                           retry_handler=retry_handler)

Weird thing is, is that get_all_buckets works:

fields.summary: boto get_bucket fails against Eucalyptus Object Store

comments.body:
Hi Harold,

It looks like when DNS name is not being used, you will need to import {{OrdinaryCallingFormat}} from {{boto.s3.connection}}.

{noformat}
from boto.s3.connection import OrdinaryCallingFormat
{noformat}

Then, we need to set {{calling_format}} to {{OrdinaryCallingFormat()}} in the boto connect command.

{noformat}

boto.connect_s3(aws_access_key_id=accesskey,
                aws_secret_access_key=secretkey,
                is_secure=False,
                host=hostname,
                port=8773,
                path="/services/objectstorage",
                calling_format=OrdinaryCallingFormat(),
                debug=2)
{noformat}

[~kedwards], works as [~shaon] mentioned.

{code}
In [1]: import boto

In [2]: from boto.s3.connection import OrdinaryCallingFormat

In [3]: s3 = boto.connect_s3(host='10.104.1.194', aws_access_key_id='AKIHTMNYTRQ0MIHQAKEY', aws_secret_access_key='yPRQ3we37Wsy26T7AA5fKhgyNlqnii2iRN2XjVTp', path='/services/objectstorage', is_secure=False, port=8773, calling_format=OrdinaryCallingFormat())

In [4]: s3.get_all_buckets()
Out[4]:
[<Bucket: 5922c0-download-manifests>,
 <Bucket: imaging-worker-v1>,
 <Bucket: loadbalancer-v1>,
 <Bucket: ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-20140411>,
 <Bucket: ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-hvm-20140411>]

In [5]: bucket_name = "ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-hvm-20140411"

In [6]: bucket = s3.get_bucket(bucket_name)


In [7]: bucket.get_all_keys()
Out[7]:
[<Key: ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-hvm-20140411,trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml>,
 <Key: ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-hvm-20140411,trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.part.00>,
 <Key: ubuntu-trusty-x86_64-hvm-20140411,trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.part.01>,

{code}

Good KB article candidate. :-)

This is not a bug.  Added a [KB article|https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/articles/201695254-Using-Python-Boto-S3-Interface-Against-Euclayptus-4-0-0-Cloud-] to document the correct instructions to use boto with a non-Eucalyptus DNS enabled 4.0.0 cloud.
